pullRequest.title: GEODE-8016: publish with non-zero-padded build ids instead of SNAPSHOT.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Artifacts take the form 1.13.0-build.123 instead of 1.13.0-SNAPSHOT.
checkPom task has been modified to use a slug instead of an always
changing version.
Gradle clients will use the greedy "1.13.0-build+" notation
Maven clients will use semver v1.0 "[1.13.0-build,1.14.0)" notation.

Signed-off-by: Robert Houghton rhoughton@pivotal.io
Thank you for submitting a contribution to Apache Geode.
In order to streamline the review of the contribution we ask you
to ensure the following steps have been taken:
For all changes:


 Is there a JIRA ticket associated with this PR? Is it referenced in the commit message?


 Has your PR been rebased against the latest commit within the target branch (typically develop)?


 Is your initial contribution a single, squashed commit?


 Does gradlew build run cleanly?


 Have you written or updated unit tests to verify your changes?


 If adding new dependencies to the code, are these dependencies licensed in a way that is compatible for inclusion under ASF 2.0?


Note:
Please ensure that once the PR is submitted, check Concourse for build issues and
submit an update to your PR as soon as possible. If you need help, please send an
email to dev@geode.apache.org.

nodes.bodyText: Can we use 1.14.0 here instead of an old version?
We don't use these other releaseQualifiers so can we remove them?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,13 +22,11 @@
 # The releaseQualifier uses the following conventions:

nodes.bodyText: just to confirm, was this change intended, or "debugging" that accidentally got left in?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@
 # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
 # limitations under the License.
 
-set -e
+set -ex

commit.message:
GEODE-8016: publish with non-zero-padded build ids instead of SNAPSHOT.

* Artifacts take the form `1.13.0-build.123` instead of `1.13.0-SNAPSHOT`.
* checkPom task has been modified to use a slug instead of an always
changing version.
* Gradle clients will use the greedy "1.13.0-build+" notation
* Maven clients will use semver v1.0 "[1.13.0-build,1.14.0)" notation.

Signed-off-by: Sean Goller <sgoller@pivotal.io>

* checkPom task has been modified to use a slug instead of an always

* Gradle clients will use the greedy "1.13.0-build+" notation
